qas.question: The abolishing of the MFA made what possible?

answers.text: Outsourcing production to low wage countries

qas.question: What did the MFA put quotas on?
What is often identified as the reason for less than ideal working conditions for garment workers?
What treaty tries to set standards for worker safety and rights?
What country has failed to ratify sections 87 and 92 of the ILO?
Abolishing what stopped outsourcing to low-wage countries?
The MFA stop quotas on what?
Wh what is often quoted is contributing to improved working conditions?
What treaty lowered standards for worker safety rights?
India has ratified all sections of what treaty?

context: <a0_0>Outsourcing production to low wage countries<a0_0/> like Bangladesh, China, India and Sri Lanka became possible when <b5_0>the Multi Fibre Agreement (MFA)<b5_0/> was abolished. The MFA, which placed quotas on <a1_0><b6_0>textiles imports<b6_0/><a1_0/>, was deemed a protectionist measure.[citation needed] <a2_0><b7_0>Globalization<b7_0/><a2_0/> is often quoted as the single most contributing factor to the poor working conditions of garment workers. Although many countries recognize treaties like <a3_0><b8_0>the <b9_0>International Labor Organization<b8_0/><a3_0/>,<b9_0/> which attempt to set standards for worker safety and rights, many countries have made exceptions to certain parts of the treaties or failed to thoroughly enforce them. <a4_0>India<a4_0/> for example has not ratified sections 87 and 92 of the treaty.[citation needed]
